aboutMe.starting: I am a Software Engineer and Full-Stack Developer with over 5 years of experience in designing and developing scalable, high-performance applications. My expertise lies in Java, Spring Boot, Vue.js, and microservices architecture. With a strong foundation in backend development, frontend design, and database optimization, I am passionate about building efficient and robust systems. Currently, I am focused on learning and exploring the integration of Artificial Intelligence and IoT into software systems and microservices architectures, aiming to develop intelligent, automated, and interconnected applications that enhance functionality, responsiveness, and user experience.

careers.name: Institute for Advanced Studies in Basic Sciences (IASBS)
careers.description: I joined the Institute for Advanced Studies in Basic Sciences (IASBS) as a Software Engineer and IT Specialist, where I worked on a combination of software development and technical IT support within an academic environment. During this period, I designed and implemented several lightweight web applications to support academic and administrative workflows. In parallel, I contributed to the technical organization of scientific conferences and academic events, ensuring reliable systems and smooth execution.
points: Designed and implemented web-based mini applications to support academic and administrative processes.
Developed applications primarily using PHP-based technologies, expanding experience with new languages and frameworks.
Provided technical and IT support for academic conferences and events, ensuring system reliability and operational stability.
Assisted with system setup, maintenance, and troubleshooting during live academic events.

This role played a key part in shaping my understanding of modern software architecture, particularly microservices-based systems and production-grade tooling. During this phase, I significantly expanded my technical stack and applied advanced software engineering concepts â€” previously studied at university â€” in real-world projects.
points: Designed and developed full-stack web applications, working on both backend and frontend components, and actively participated in the transition from monolithic architectures to microservices-based systems to improve scalability and modularity.

careers.name: Pardazeshgaran Behin Sayar Co.
careers.description: This internship marked my first hands-on industry experience during my university studies, where I was introduced to real-world backend development through a patient management system developed for a hospital in my hometown. During this period, I built a strong foundation in backend technologies and software development practices, gradually transitioning from academic concepts to practical implementation. I worked primarily with Java and the Spring Framework, which later became my core backend technology stack. Alongside backend development, I gained exposure to database systems and basic frontend technologies, allowing me to understand the end-to-end structure of web applications.
points: Developed backend components for a hospital patient management system, working with real-world data models and business logic.
Built backend components using Java and the Spring Framework, learning core concepts such as layered architecture, dependency injection, and RESTful service development.
Became familiar with database-driven application design, while gradually learning the limitations of ORM-only approaches and the importance of understanding underlying database behavior.
Gained introductory experience with frontend development using Angular, implementing a beginner-level user interface for a UI Builder project.
Developed an understanding of end-to-end application workflows, from backend services and data persistence to basic frontend integration.
